Meetings will take place in room MAR 6.051.
The exam can be de-/registered from April 1st until April 30, 11:59 p.m. via

. Students who have not registered for the exam before the deadline will be dropped from the project. Students who (after prior registration) have not deregistered from the exam before the deadline will be graded regardless of attendance. This also applies to Erasmus and exchange students.
Aktivität In principle, in project courses given by the CV&R... auswählen

In principle, in project courses given by the CV&RS research group, participants will gain significant insights into computer vision related problems and solutions. The goal is not to explore the whole field of research completely, but rather to confront the participants with the full complexity of one specific problem and to challenge their own initiative. Therefore, we do not provide a pedagogically gentle introduction of the learners to the scientific area, but we allow insights and participation in research and development.
The ability of the participants to work in a team shall be improved by this module.
You can mostly use standard NeRFs. However, you will need to change the whole NeRF pipeline to binary setting,
i.e. change neural network, loss function, sampling etc.
Your initial focus should be in extracting good masks:
List of general Image Segmentation Models:
You need to combine NeRFs that optimize camera parameters and NeRFs that include estimation of changes (occlusions, illumination changes, etc. )
We would like to combine Gaussian Splats with a Deformation model.
